data.title: Smith, Staebell, Voegele, Mesker

Eissenzaemer-Studer 17??: Joseph Eissenzaemer and Barbara Studer ·

Maria Barbe

Ennesser-Schiringer/Riedt 1667/1676: François Ennesser and (1) Elisabeth Schiringer, (2) Anna Riedt ·

François Ennesser and Elisabeth Schiringer:

Married 29-Jan-1667 at Saint Nicolas Catholic Church in Haguenau

Child:

Jean-Michel, 1684-1764, married Anne Marie Moser 1713

François Ennesser and Anna Riedt:

Married 07-Nov-1676 at Saint Nicolas Catholic Church in Haguenau

Children:

Anne Marie, ca.1682-1746, married Jean Henri Lux

Marie Elisabeth, b.1684, married Maurice Vincent

Barbara, b.1685 in Kutzenhausen, married François Lustig 1708

Married 07-Aug-1835 in Soufflenheim, Alsace, France

Known children:

Wendelin

(1) Married Mary Suttel on 19-Nov-1878

(2) Married Mary Suttel on 08-Nov-1881

Maria, 1844-1918, m. Pierre Strack

Glöckler-Wild/Judt 17??/1747: Ottilia Glöckler and (1) Johann Georg Wild, (2) Martin Judt ·

Johann Georg Wild and Ottilia Glöckler were probably married in Göcklingen, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany

Children of Johann Georg Wild and Ottilia Glöckler:

Johann (Jean), born ca.1738

Martin Judt and Ottilia Glöckler were married in 1747, probably in Göcklingen, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany, and then lived in Martin's home town of Soufflenheim, Bas-Rhin (Alsace), France

Children of Martin Judt and Ottilia Glöckler, all born in Soufflenmeheim:

Maria Eva, born 02-Mar-1750, baptized 03-Mar-1750

Laurentius, born 07-Jun-1752, baptized 08-Jun-1752

Maria Magdalena, born and baptized 06-Jun-1757

Mathias, b.1767

Matthias, b.1769

Maria Anna, b.1770

Gragg-Curtis 1842: John Gragg and Malinda Curtis ·

Photos

Internet Genealogies of the Gragg Family

Married 11-Aug-1842 in Ashe County, North Carolina

Watauga County was formed from Ashe County in 1849

John's second wife was named Martisha

They married after the 1870 census and before the 1880 census

Martisha's name from a prior marriage was likely Willson

John and Martisha had no known children

Known children:

Nancy S., b. 1843 or 1844 in Watauga County or Caldwell County, North Carolina

Celia Jane, 1845-1903, m. Baird

Temper C. (female), b. 1847 or 1848 in North Carolina

Louisa (or Eliza) Ann, b. 1849 in North Carolina

Susan Merica, 1851-1942?

Sophia E., b. 1853 or 1854 in North Carolina

Thomas C., b. 1856 or 1857 in North Carolina

Clarisa or Claricy S., b. 1858 or 1859 in North Carolina

William R. or John W.P., b. Mar-1865 in North Carolina

Might he be the same as "Robie"?

Callie E., b. 28-Nov-1867? in North Carolina, m. James E. Haun

Ida, b. 1868 or 1869 in Tennessee

Ida is probably the the first child of Louisa Ann, born 20-Mar-1869, four years before Louisa's marriage to William Bedent Baird.

Green-Staebell 19??: Charles Green and Theresa J. Staebell ·

One child, Living.

Gregg-Gragg 18??: Susan Gragg and (1) George Gregg, (2) Mr. Campbell, and (3) Alpheus Pierce ·

Children of Susan and George Gregg:

Margaret ("Maggie"), b. 25-Mar-1873, m. Frank Freeman

Alice Suefemra, 1879-1979

Susan did not have any children with her husbands Mr. Campbell and Alpheus Pierce

One of Susan's first two marriages (I'm not sure which one) ended in divorce

Mr. Campbell lived in Iron Mountain, Dickinson County, Michigan

Mr. Campbell has a descendant (but not a descendant of Susan's?) named Jack Campbell who still lives in Michigan

Susan and Alpheus Pierce married in Couer d'Alene, Idaho

Alpheus Pierce had a wooden leg.

Married 1894 or 1895

Emma R., b. Nov-1895

Married Frank Soderburg

Their son was J. Frank Soderburg

Walter, 1899-1992

The Social Security Death Index lists this person named Haun living in Garfield, Washington. I do not know for sure that he is a member of the Haun-Gragg family:

Samuel Haun, b. 30-Jun-1897, d. 14-May-1988

Samuel W. Haun, age 12, appears in the 1910 census for Garfield, Whitman County, Washington (p.26); he is the son of Benjamin Haun of Tennessee and his wife Ann E. Haun.

Haun Family 19??: Walter Haun and Camille Haun ·

Camille's married name is Haun; her maiden name is unknown

No children

Photo

Marie Ann, b. 03-Aug-1825 in Niederlauterbach, married Louis Ott

John Rheinhart, b. 06-Jun-1827, d. 05-Dec-1898 in Batavia, Genesee County, NY, married Mary Prill

Regina (Reine), b. 01-Aug-1831 in Niederlauterbach, married Henry Balthasar

Joseph, b. 03-Sep-1833 in Niederlauterbach, d. 23-Apr-1899 in Sacremento, Sacramento County, CA, married Mary Meyer

Magdalena, born in New York

Barbara, b. ca. 1837 in Erie County, New York, married Joseph Ochs

Jacob, b. 11-Aug-1840 in New York, d. 02-Jul-1896 in Sacramento, Sacramento County, CA, married Julia Kieffer

Joseph, b. 1849 or 1850

Egede, b. 1853 or 1854, died 11-Jun-1882 in Buffalo

Hock-Rusch 1840: Claudius Hock and Anna Maria Rusch ·

Anna, b. 1842 or 1843

Theresa, b. 1844 or 1845

Frank, b. 1848 or 1849

In 1880, Frank, single, was living with his mother Anna, working as a farmer

Lewis, b. 1850 or 1851, m. 1876 to Mary Faeth(?)

Probable match, from United German and French Cemetery in Cheektowaga:

Hock, Louis A. b: 1851 d: 1922 Father

Hock, Mary Ann b: 1856 d: 1914 Mother

Anthony, b. 1853 or 1854

Probable match, from United German and French Cemetery in Cheektowaga:

Hock, Anthony d: 16 Sep 1903 Aged 49Yrs 4Mo 10Da

Jacob, b. 03-May-1857

Godfather: Frank Hock

I believe this birth date is in error. It is two days before his sister's, and I do not find it in the Surbourg baptism records for this date.

The name of the first wife of Thomas Kieffer is unknown. Anna Maria Schitt is his second wife.
